intro: Hieracium taurinense, commonly known as the Taurine Hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its yellow flowers bloom from June to August, and it thrives in moist, calcareous soils. Hieracium taurinense is often found in meadows, pastures, and woodland edges, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
